sentence.Network_en: The paintings are the consummation of his life's work.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些画是他毕生努力的完美结晶。

sentence.Network_en: This terrace was the final consummation of the house's plan.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个平台是这所房子设计中最完美的杰作.

sentence.Network_en: The bold and brilliant dream still awaits its consummation.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个勇敢明智的理想仍有待实现.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin consummatio(n-), from the verb consummare (see consummate)

entry.tran: 造诣极高的;技艺精湛的;炉火纯青的
entry.def: You use consummate to describe someone who is extremely skilful.

example.ex: He acted the part with consummate skill...
example.tran: 他以精湛的演技饰演了这一角色。

example.ex: Those familiar with Sanders call him a consummate politician.
example.tran: 那些熟悉桑德斯的人都称他为手段高明的政治家。

entry.tran: 圆房;通过性交使(婚姻或两人关系)圆满
entry.def: If two people consummate a marriage or relationship, they make it complete by having sex.

example.ex: They consummated their passion only after many hesitations and delays.
example.tran: 他们几经踌躇和拖延后才尽情宣泄了激情。

entry.def: To consummate an agreement means to complete it.

example.ex: There have been several close calls, but no one has been able to consummate a deal.
example.tran: 有好几次死里逃生，却没有人做成一笔交易。

means.word_mean: 1. the completion of marriage by sexual intercourse
2. the act of bringing to completion or fruition

stems_affixes.word_buile: summ总,加+ary表形容词或名词→内容总和→摘要
summ总,加+ary表形容词或名词→内容总和→摘要
consummate[adj.完全的,完美的 v.完成]+ion表名词→n.达到极点,完成
summ总,加+ation表名词→n.[数]总和,和,合计

stems_affixes.value_cn: 顶,最高点;颠峰,高峰;最高级会议
stems_affixes.word_buile: summ总,加+it表名词→山的顶峰像数量总和一样→最高[多]数量→最高峰
summary[n.摘要,概要 adj.概括的,简略的]+ize表动词→summarize概括,总结
